required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: The Hemodynamic Effects of PACAP38 After Glibenclamide Administration in Healthy Volunteers
clinical_study.official_title: The Hemodynamic Effects of PACAP38 After Glibenclamide Administration in Healthy Volunteers

brief_summary.textblock: To investigate the hemodynamic effects of PACAP38 after glibenclamide administration.

detailed_description.textblock:
22 healthy participants will randomly be allocated to receive PACAP38 infusion followed by glibenclamide or placebo on two different days.
The aim of the study is to investigate the vascular effect of PACAP38 after glibenclamide administration.
Repeated measurements covering the arteria radialis (RA), superficial temporal artery (STA) and middle cerebral artery (MCA) before and after PACAP38 infusion and glibenclamide/placebo administration

study_design_info.intervention_model_description: Randomized, double-blind, cross-over, placebo-controlled design in healthy volunteers.
study_design_info.masking: Quadruple (Participant, Care Provider, Investigator, Outcomes Assessor)

primary_outcome.time_frame: Time of headache measurements is from before (-20 minutes) and up to 12 hours after PACAP38 infusion
primary_outcome.description: Headache intensity will be recorded by numerical rating scale (NRS) from 0 to 10 (0, no headache; 1, a feeling of pressure; 10, worst imaginable headache).

secondary_outcome.measure: Changes in the arterial radialis (RA), superficial temporal artery (STA) and middle cerebral artery (MCA).
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Time of measurements is baseline and repeatedly every 20 minutes for 260 minutes.
secondary_outcome.description: Repeated measurements covering the diameter of RA, STA and MCA before and after PACAP38 infusion and glibenclamide/placebo administration measured by centimeter (cm)

arm_group.description: Participants will receive glibenclamide after PACAP38 infusion
Participants will receive placebo after PACAP38 infusion

intervention.description: Oral administration of glibenclamide/placebo. To investigate the role of PACAP38 on cranial arteries in healthy volunteers after glibenclamide/placebo administration .

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Healthy volunteers of both sexes.
- 18-60 years.
- 50-100 kg.
- Women of childbearing age must use adequate contraception
Exclusion Criteria:
- A history of serious somatic or psychiatric disease
- Migraine or any other type of headache (except episodic tension-type headache less than 5 days per month)
- Daily intake of any medication except contraceptives
